#  VISIT THE NEW BEDFORD WHALING MUSEUM

## Tickets

Online ticketing is now our primary method of selling admission. Discounted admission tickets can only be purchased onsite.

Museum & [3D Movie](http://web.archive.org/web/20251217071331/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/visit/big-blue-pictures/) | Price  
---|---  
Adults | $27  
Seniors (65+) | $25  
Youth | $17  
Museum Members | $4  
  
Museum Only | Price  
---|---  
Adults | $23  
Senior (65+) | $21  
Youth | $13  
Museum Members | FREE  
  
[ Purchase Tickets ](http://web.archive.org/web/20251217071331/https://buy.acmeticketing.com/orders/495/calendar)

**Groups**

**Student Groups  
**Students can marvel at the whale skeletons, climb aboard the  _Lagoda_ whaling ship, and view the New Bedford harbor from the Observation Deck. Extend your trip with additional learning activities like a squid dissection, 3-D movie, curator-led tour of a special exhibit, or visit to the Research Room. Groups of 10 or more students qualify for a discounted...

accessibility_text:
#  Accessibility

The New Bedford Whaling Museum is committed to creating an engaging and accessible experience for all guests and staff. This page outlines some of the resources available during your visit.

## **Questions? Contact US**

Visitor Experience team at 508-997-0046 x100 or [access@whalingmuseum.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101070900/mailto:access@whalingmuseum.org) for further information on accessibility.

## Planning Your Visit

##  Arrival & Admissions 

##  Exploring the Exhibitions

## **Planning your visit**

**Exploring Our Website  
**If you need to enlarge or reduce the size of the text, press "Ctrl +" and "Ctrl -" for custom sizing. For more accessibility functionality look into your web browser’s settings for tools and extensions, including: live captioning, highlighting, text readers, translation, and more.  
**  
Visitor Guide / Floor Plan**  
Our [Visitor Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101070900/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/NBWM-Visitor-Guide-2023.pdf) (also available in [Chinese](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101070900/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Chinese-Visitor-Guide-2023.pdf), [French](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101070900/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/French-Visitor-Guide-2023.pdf), [Japanese](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101070900/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/Japanese-Visitor-Guide-2023.pdf), [Portuguese](http...
collections_text:
## Members’ Trip: São Miguel

# October 14 through 23, 2026

Embark on a very special trip to São Miguel with fellow Museum Members and special guest travel host Maria Lawton!

[Learn More](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115044812/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/program/members-trip-2026-sao-miguel/)

## OPEN NOW

** _Forging Independence - Building a Nation_**

This exhibition introduces invites visitors to form connections between historical events and pressing issues of today, to consider what ideas are embodied in the terms and ideas of Independence and Nationhood.

[Learn More](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115044812/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/exhibition/forging-independence-building-a-nation/)

## New 3D film!

**_Wonders of the Arctic_**

Set in the frozen wilderness at the top of the world,  _Wonders of the Arctic_ tells the story of survival in one of the most unforgiving environments on earth dominated by a single element: ice. Faraway in this glittering world of ice and snow, polar bears tussle, huskies howl and narwhals dive within the turquoise waters. Through compelling stories told by scientists and Inuit leaders, viewers will discover the impact of ice on the Arctic’s inhabitants, both animals and humans.

[Learn More](http://web.archive.org/web/20260115044812/https://www.whalingmuseum.org/visit/big-blue-pictures/)
